page.title: 03She saved the train....
page.content: June 24,1985.Today we went to interview Mrs.Bernice Roberts,who,50 years ago ran two miles to warn the Newtown signal box that a tree swept down the Mochdre river by flood had made the Scafell bridge dangerous.Mrs.Roberts was a national heroine after her brave deed.Today the river Severn and its tributaries are in flood less often because of the Clywedog dam in the hills and work done on strengthening the river banks and lowering the bed.Before this floods were a great nuisance;furniture and carpets were ruined,and farmland covered with water for weeks.
